title: Understanding Invisible Disabilities
text: Invisible disabilities are not immediately apparent to others. They can include conditions like autism, ADHD, or chronic pain, which do not have visible signs.

title: Characteristics of Invisible Disabilities
text: Children with invisible disabilities often appear like their typically developing peers, as there are no physical characteristics that distinguish them.

hintAnswer: no physical characteristics readily identify a person with an invisible disability, because these children look like typically developing children
title: Identifying Invisible Disabilities
text: What is a key feature of invisible disabilities?
choices: no physical characteristics readily identify a person with an invisible disability, because these children look like typically developing children
a disability that turns you invisible
